dbrown

Class RTGraphicView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • dbrown.RTGraphicView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class RTGraphicView
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    Displays a right triangle as a graphic within a JComponent with a blank border of size BORDER. The upper right corner of the triangle can be selected and used to change the size of the triangle by dragging with with mouse.
    Version:
    2012-10-25
    Author:
    David Brown from Byron Weber-Becker
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Inner class for allowing the triangle to be dragged in order to change its size.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides JComponent's paintComponent method. Draws the triangle and adds a handle to the top corner of the triangle.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        See Also:
        JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • layoutView

        private void layoutView()
        Empty method: the JComponent contains no further elements.

      • registerListeners

        private void registerListeners()
        Adds the mouse and change listeners.

      • setScales

        private void setScales()
        Calculate the triangle to window scaling. The same scaling is applied to both the base and height in order to preserve the 'look' of the triangle.
